title: The Enschedé Font Foundry releases Gerrit Noordzij's Burgundica
content:
In typical Enschedé fashion, with understated fanfare:

[http://www.teff.nl/fonts/burgundica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317111829/http:/www.teff.nl/fonts/burgundica/)

Astounding. And four weights! I never knew there was more than one! I always loved the caps in this design. There is nothing like them anywhere else.

Be sure to click on the "Concept" link and dig the early version of the uppercase K. It's so good to see this typeface finally available. It also mentions that Noordzij's Tret is in production at TEFF and to be released in the future.
author: johnbutler

comments.content: Aargh. It seems the headline renderer likes to gobble up anything beyond ASCII.
Wow, this is lovely. A black letter with a graceful, light touch.

I think Blackletter might be pushing it William. Bastarda vs. Textus percissus.

It is beautiful though.

Michael

Ah, now I see on Google Books [what you are talking about.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317111829/http:/books.google.com/books?id=a59Ev3XZkHcC&pg=PA83&lpg=PA83&dq=textus+precissus&source=bl&ots=bLjOownAUn&sig=1udrDR_k_ECyOsKwHd4JS8aiDY4&hl=en&ei=k20kSvTaDo7Ktge4y6zlBg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5#PPA86,M1) Interesting.
